title: Bump Tokio and Regex versions
body:
Updating Tokio ensures [RUSTSEC-2021-0124](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2021-0124.html) will not happen if `tokio::sync::oneshot` is used in the future

Updating Regex fixes [RUSTSEC-2022-0013](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2022-0013.html) which allows DOS attack/issues. better safe than sorry.

~~I don't know why the commit is `Unverified` I made the change through GitHub's web editor so it would automatically create the fork~~

First two commits where done through VSCode so they didn't get signed when I was committing, sorry for the inconsistency of the `Verified` tag.

title: fix broken serenity event handler
body: Serenity seems to have had a recent update that removed the CategoryCreate and CategoryDelete Event enum variants. This PR removes those variants as well. Tested by checking if the lib compiles.

title: Revert "fix: to_string in command macro clashes with lint clippy::str_to_string"
body: Reverts kangalioo/poise#104

title: fix: to_string in command macro clashes with lint clippy::str_to_string
body:
HI there,

I have a Clippy lint that clashes with the generated code in the command macro. Here is the Clippy lint page: https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#str_to_string
The other way of doing so is by adding a `#[allow(clippy::str_to_string)]` before the expression.

I can make the other change if wanted

Thanks for your time

title: Allow getting reference to inner message object easier
body: This renames `ReplyHandle::message` to `ReplyHandle::into_message` and adds `ReplyHandle::message` to return `Cow<Message>`.

title: Don't pull in chrono by default
body: Avoids pulling in the unmaintained and vulnerable chrono library via a serenity feature by default

title: Localization
body:
Fixes #79

As described in #79, there are two ways to localize commands: via attributes, or programmatically.

Attributes are good for small scale bots because they're easy to get started with and simple: for example `#[name_localized("de", "Befehlsname")]` to set the German-localized name to "Befehlsname". A full example is in examples/framework_usage/commands/localization.rs

The programmatical approach is better for larger bots that use a translation framework like gettext, fluent: you can insert localizations of all commands with a single code snippet by modifying the `name_localizations` and `description_localizations` fields of `Command`, `CommandParameter` and `CommandParameterChoice`. A full example is in examples/fluent_localization/

CI on this PR currently fails due to deprecation warnings that haven't been released to crates.io. I'd like to fix those warnings in a separate commit, so I'll leave this PR's CI failing.

title: Fix default_member_permissions
body: Permissions::empty means only admins can run the command, not that there are no permission requirements. Only not supplying the field allows anyone to use the command.

title: Fix clippy warnings
body: Does what it says on the tin!

title: Use the `ephemeral(bool)` methods of the response builders
body: <!-- please base the PR on the develop branch if possible 😇 -->

title: Minimize monomorphization-caused codegen bloat
body:
the send_application_reply and send_prefix_reply functions are quite long, very commonly called functions, which are generic over their respective builder function. 
During monomorphization, these function bodies get duplicated for each different closure passed to the functions, thus causing a lot of unnecessary codegen output.
By putting most of the function body into a non-generic inner function, we can minimize the impact of this, resulting in a noticable decrease in generated LLVM.

- `dm_only` - only run on dm channels (opposite of `guild_only`)
- `nsfw_only` - only run on nsfw channels
